sentences: Ta ei taha puutu oma tööga.
context: The Estonian word 'puutu' appears to be a form of the verb 'puutuma', which means 'to touch' or 'to come into contact with'. It can also mean 'to deal with', 'to concern', or 'to relate to' in various contexts. This is a common verb used when describing physical contact as well as metaphorical relationships between things, people, or topics.
